title: danherbias07
author: danherbias07
content: https://www.fiba.basketball/basketballworldcup/202325 Days remaining before the start of the FIBA Basketball World Cup. You can see the countdown on the link provided. QuoteThe FIBA Basketball World Cup 2023 will take place in the Philippines, Japan, and Indonesia from August 25 to September 10. The 32 participating teams will play in 92 games played over 16 days.Here are the participating countries and their Groups. Here are the odds for the Winner. https://stake.games/sports/outright/basketball/international/fiba-world-cup/43603898-fiba-world-cup-2023And here are the odds for Group Winners.Betting early has its perks because everything will change when the game starts and teams are winning. Let's have some fun discussing this great event before it starts. Share your picks, share your thoughts, or anything about the event. IMO, looks like Lithuania will have an easy road ahead. So do Spain and Serbia.

comments.author: AHOYBRAUSE
comments.body: I just wanted to create a thread for the world cup but thought " I better check if there already is one '   .Another 3 weeks of waiting until the world cup finally kicks off.We had tickets for 2 group games of the German team but unfortunately can't go because of work. I could go by myself but that's less fun, the flight is just 2 hours to Okinawa though. Whatever, I will watch it on TV. I think Japanese TV should broadcast some games here, at least the Japanese ones. And since my German team is in the same group I got lucky.Speaking of which, I think the German team has a hard group. Australia we can't beat, their roster is too deep with plenty of NBA power.We also have some NBA players such as Dennis Schröder, the Wagner brothers and ageing Daniel Theiss. Also some good Euroleague players that got 3rd place in last years Eurobasket. Unfortunately Maxi Kleber doesn't play because of his recent beef with Dennis Schröder and Isaiah Hartenstein also won't play, don't know why, maybe because he just married.Beating Japan (without Hachimura) should be possible but Finland will be another hard game. People expect the German team to win it but I am not so sure about that, with Lauri they have a big name and the rest of the team also has some solid talent.Getting out of the group would already be a success, everything else is extra for our German squad.

comments.author: Wapfika
comments.body: Nice thread. I’m surprised that Canada is on the second favorite to win the FIBA. I’m not familiar to there roster so anyone here enlighten me on what’s the backgorund of their roster for the bookie to give that odds for them to win? I was hoping to see Spain, France and Greece to be on that spot.I wonder if the current odds of Serbia will still the same of Jokic decided to participate on FIBA this year. I think Serbia has a chance to beat USA if Jokic can lead his teammates since no one can stop him in the whole NBA league.

comments.author: AHOYBRAUSE
comments.body: Quote from: Wapfika on August 02, 2023, 12:45:14 PMNice thread. I’m surprised that Canada is on the second favorite to win the FIBA. I’m not familiar to there roster so anyone here enlighten me on what’s the backgorund of their roster for the bookie to give that odds for them to win? I was hoping to see Spain, France and Greece to be on that spot.I wonder if the current odds of Serbia will still the same of Jokic decided to participate on FIBA this year. I think Serbia has a chance to beat USA if Jokic can lead his teammates since no one can stop him in the whole NBA league.1 or 2 days ago Jokic announced that he won't play at the world cup, so the chances to win for Serbia got significantly smaller after those news.Canada has a great team this year with a lot of high caliber NBA players: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander (Oklahoma City Thunder), Jamal Murray (Denver Nuggets), RJ Barrett (New York Knicks) , Dillon Brooks (Houston Rockets), Oshae Brissett (Boston Celtics), Luguentz Dort (Oklahoma City Thunder), Nickeil Alexander-Walker (Minnesota Timberwolves), Cory Joseph (Golden State Warriors), Kelly Olynyk (Utah Jazz) and Dwight Powell (Dallas Mavericks) .For me this team looks even better than team USA to be honest.

comments.author: Kelvinid
comments.body: I'm surprised by the odds of Spain; they used to be a good team. Maybe it's because the two Gasols are not playing anymore, which is why their chances, based on the odds, have dropped. Personally, I still find this team a good one to bet on. With the odds of x12, I find it very attractive, and I might bet a small amount on them to win the competition.As for our national team, they are in Group A. I'm not sure if the Philippines could at least win a game in the FIBA World Cup, but hopefully, they'll manage to secure a victory. Our ranking in international competitions, particularly in FIBA, is still quite low.Currently, the Philippines is ranked at number 40. You can check the rankings here: https://www.fiba.basketball/rankingmen...However, it's surprising that Spain is at the top, and their odds do not seem to reflect their ranking.

comments.author: Yogee
comments.body: Quote from: Kelvinid on August 02, 2023, 01:41:35 PMI'm surprised by the odds of Spain; they used to be a good team. Maybe it's because the two Gasols are not playing anymore, which is why their chances, based on the odds, have dropped. Personally, I still find this team a good one to bet on. With the odds of x12, I find it very attractive, and I might bet a small amount on them to win the competition.Yes first thing I did upon opening the thread was look for Spain's odds as I expected them to be the second favorite. I also thought it's a good chance for the Spanish team to win since the USA team is composed of young talents.Team Canada surprised me at first but it made sense after looking at their roster.

comments.author: casperBGD
comments.body: Quote from: AHOYBRAUSE on August 02, 2023, 01:00:47 PM-snip1 or 2 days ago Jokic announced that he won't play at the world cup, so the chances to win for Serbia got significantly smaller after those news.Canada has a great team Jokic would not play, but Micic is questionable as well, so Serbia chances getting high are depending on draw, but QF is probably maximum that we can hope forCanada looks great, but Murray is also questionable and could skip World Cup, with him, Canada has good chances to go till the end, and odds on that look good, @4.75 seems as value betwill look through Canada preparation matches, to see how they work togethergreat topic BTW

comments.author: danherbias07
comments.body: Quote from: Kelvinid on August 02, 2023, 01:41:35 PMCurrently, the Philippines is ranked at number 40. You can check the rankings here: https://www.fiba.basketball/rankingmen...Yeah, the Philippines is underrated when it comes to basketball so that's normal. This may be the time we can showcase our skills and maybe change that perspective. Quote from: Kelvinid on August 02, 2023, 01:41:35 PMHowever, it's surprising that Spain is at the top, and their odds do not seem to reflect their ranking.Overall rankings, yes but remember USA is there so I guess that changes everything and I won't rely on that rankings anymore. Canada also is a strong team so Spain will have a hard time winning this FIBA Cup. Those who like taking risk for Spain will make some good profits if they win it. Quote from: AHOYBRAUSE on August 02, 2023, 12:36:41 PMI just wanted to create a thread for the world cup but thought " I better check if there already is one '   .Thank you for checking it first and coming here.Quote from: AHOYBRAUSE on August 02, 2023, 12:36:41 PMAnother 3 weeks of waiting until the world cup finally kicks off.We had tickets for 2 group games of the German team but unfortunately can't go because of work. I could go by myself but that's less fun, the flight is just 2 hours to Okinawa though. 3 weeks will be fast. Wow, you can watch the games? Nice. They will play here in the Philippines but I am having doubts because of the typhoon, the rain won't stop yet and there's strong wind in some parts of the Luzon region. I hope before the game starts, this typhoon will be out of our area. Quote from: AHOYBRAUSE on August 02, 2023, 12:36:41 PMBeating Japan (without Hachimura) should be possible but Finland will be another hard game. People expect the German team to win it but I am not so sure about that, with Lauri they have a big name and the rest of the team also has some solid talent.Getting out of the group would already be a success, everything else is extra for our German squad.Finland is not to be messed with, they showed good basketball during the EuroBasket event. Oh and here are the NBA players who will play the FIBA basketball World Cup 2023. QuoteFIBA World Cup 2023: Tracking which NBA players are participatinghttps://www.nba.com/news/fiba-world-cup-roster-tracker-2023Germany has Schroder, Theiss, and the Wagner Brothers. This will be hard to beat.Quote from: casperBGD on August 02, 2023, 02:26:20 PMCanada looks great, but Murray is also questionable and could skip World Cup, with him, Canada has good chances to go till the end, and odds on that look good, @4.75 seems as value betwill look through Canada preparation matches, to see how they work togethergreat topic BTWBut they still have SGA, Brooks, Powell, and Barrett. Still a scary lineup.

comments.author: bisdak40
comments.body: Quote from: Kelvinid on August 02, 2023, 01:41:35 PMI'm surprised by the odds of Spain; they used to be a good team. Maybe it's because the two Gasols are not playing anymore, which is why their chances, based on the odds, have dropped. Personally, I still find this team a good one to bet on. With the odds of x12, I find it very attractive, and I might bet a small amount on them to win the competition.As for our national team, they are in Group A. I'm not sure if the Philippines could at least win a game in the FIBA World Cup, but hopefully, they'll manage to secure a victory. Our ranking in international competitions, particularly in FIBA, is still quite low.Currently, the Philippines is ranked at number 40. You can check the rankings here: https://www.fiba.basketball/rankingmen...However, it's surprising that Spain is at the top, and their odds do not seem to reflect their ranking.Though Spain lost the Gasol brothers but they are still one of the teams to beat. It's not the players who are playing but i think it's the system that is why we always see Spain in the quarters in the FIBA World Cup.That @12.00 is worth a try, who knows that they will be the champion again this year.Our beloved Philippines may be winless on their group but being there with the top guns i think is an honor and a win is just a bonus.Nice thread BTW OP.

comments.author: Sanitough
comments.body: Quote from: bisdak40 on August 03, 2023, 04:03:47 AMQuote from: Kelvinid on August 02, 2023, 01:41:35 PMI'm surprised by the odds of Spain; they used to be a good team. Maybe it's because the two Gasols are not playing anymore, which is why their chances, based on the odds, have dropped. Personally, I still find this team a good one to bet on. With the odds of x12, I find it very attractive, and I might bet a small amount on them to win the competition.As for our national team, they are in Group A. I'm not sure if the Philippines could at least win a game in the FIBA World Cup, but hopefully, they'll manage to secure a victory. Our ranking in international competitions, particularly in FIBA, is still quite low.Currently, the Philippines is ranked at number 40. You can check the rankings here: https://www.fiba.basketball/rankingmen...However, it's surprising that Spain is at the top, and their odds do not seem to reflect their ranking.Though Spain lost the Gasol brothers but they are still one of the teams to beat. It's not the players who are playing but i think it's the system that is why we always see Spain in the quarters in the FIBA World Cup.That @12.00 is worth a try, who knows that they will be the champion again this year.They can prove themselves if they win despite not having the Gasol brothers, and I agree with you that it's the system that makes them a good team. The last time they won a championship was in 2019 when Ricky Rubio led the team.Let's revisit the scoreboards and see how many players are still active now:https://www.fiba.basketball/basketballworldcup/2019/game/1509/Argentina-Spain#|tab=boxscoreIt's certain that Marc Gasol won't be playing.Quote from: bisdak40 on August 03, 2023, 04:03:47 AMOur beloved Philippines may be winless on their group but being there with the top guns i think is an honor and a win is just a bonus.I also doubt they'll win, but seeing them being competitive is enough for me. And since Jordan Clarkson has confirmed he will represent the country, that would give them the confidence to play harder and aim for a win despite their low ranking compared to the teams in the same bracket.

comments.author: Kelvinid
comments.body: Quote from: Yogee on August 02, 2023, 02:23:20 PMQuote from: Kelvinid on August 02, 2023, 01:41:35 PMI'm surprised by the odds of Spain; they used to be a good team. Maybe it's because the two Gasols are not playing anymore, which is why their chances, based on the odds, have dropped. Personally, I still find this team a good one to bet on. With the odds of x12, I find it very attractive, and I might bet a small amount on them to win the competition.Yes first thing I did upon opening the thread was look for Spain's odds as I expected them to be the second favorite. I also thought it's a good chance for the Spanish team to win since the USA team is composed of young talents.They were an underrated team, I believe, so if we believe they are going to win, then I guess we should not doubt taking those x12 odds. Despite losing the Gasol brothers, they still have the majority of the talent that brought them success, if I'm not mistaken. So whether they lose or win, I'm sure Spain is not going home without putting up a tough competition.Quote from: Yogee on August 02, 2023, 02:23:20 PMTeam Canada surprised me at first but it made sense after looking at their roster.I'm not sure if this is the updated roster (https://www.fiba.basketball/basketballworldcup/2023/americas-qualifiers/team/Canada) but looking at the roster, they have some great players in the NBA especially SGA, so they can be stronger compared to the last time they were in competition.

comments.author: Dave1
comments.body: Quote from: AHOYBRAUSE on August 02, 2023, 01:00:47 PMQuote from: Wapfika on August 02, 2023, 12:45:14 PMNice thread. I’m surprised that Canada is on the second favorite to win the FIBA. I’m not familiar to there roster so anyone here enlighten me on what’s the backgorund of their roster for the bookie to give that odds for them to win? I was hoping to see Spain, France and Greece to be on that spot.I wonder if the current odds of Serbia will still the same of Jokic decided to participate on FIBA this year. I think Serbia has a chance to beat USA if Jokic can lead his teammates since no one can stop him in the whole NBA league.1 or 2 days ago Jokic announced that he won't play at the world cup, so the chances to win for Serbia got significantly smaller after those news.Canada has a great team this year with a lot of high caliber NBA players: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander (Oklahoma City Thunder), Jamal Murray (Denver Nuggets), RJ Barrett (New York Knicks) , Dillon Brooks (Houston Rockets), Oshae Brissett (Boston Celtics), Luguentz Dort (Oklahoma City Thunder), Nickeil Alexander-Walker (Minnesota Timberwolves), Cory Joseph (Golden State Warriors), Kelly Olynyk (Utah Jazz) and Dwight Powell (Dallas Mavericks) .For me this team looks even better than team USA to be honest.Yes, I also take notice that Canada will have a NBA players in their list, so I wouldn't be surprised if they are in the second spot as far as the favorites goes. So and with that kind of lineup, yeah for sure they will give the Americans a run for their money with this kind of lineup.However, I think the Americans can and will win this tournament, it's not gonna be easy though.So for me, there could be some surprises on other brackets, specially if host country plays and they are the underdog.

comments.author: Distinctin
comments.body: Quote from: Dave1 on August 03, 2023, 11:12:44 AMHowever, I think the Americans can and will win this tournament, it's not gonna be easy though.So for me, there could be some surprises on other brackets, specially if host country plays and they are the underdog.They are the best team in this tournament, but the USA did not send their best players, unlike before when they made sure they would win the competition. With the chemistry and experience of other national teams, they have a better advantage compared to the USA. The USA's advantage obviously lies in their talent, but you know, in crucial games, experience is more helpful than talent as it's about making the right decisions.I'm thinking maybe one of the 3 will win the FIBA world cup. 1-Australia2-France3-Spain

comments.author: rdbase
comments.body: Very interesting to see this World Cup of Basketball as many are seeing this tournament to be.Many NBA players won't be playing on their countries respective teams so the odds would be reflective of this.Because then USA would be closer to 1.01x if you have Lebron or Damian Lillard playing against compared g-league players from the country opponents.Might be some players who want to keep in form playing in these brackets so would also be interesting to see a list of them on here and which teams they will be playing on.Could you make this happen @danherbias07 ?Such as Kai Sotto will be playing in this FIBA tournament for Team Philippines? Now that would be great for one of the host nations to have an actual NBA player on their team roster available to play.

comments.author: cryptomaniac_xxx
comments.body: Quote from: rdbase on August 03, 2023, 01:10:11 PMVery interesting to see this World Cup of Basketball as many are seeing this tournament to be.Many NBA players won't be playing on their countries respective teams so the odds would be reflective of this.Because then USA would be closer to 1.01x if you have Lebron or Damian Lillard playing against compared g-league players from the country opponents.Might be some players who want to keep in form playing in these brackets so would also be interesting to see a list of them on here and which teams they will be playing on.Could you make this happen @danherbias07 ?Such as Kai Sotto will be playing in this FIBA tournament for Team Philippines? Now that would be great for one of the host nations to have an actual NBA player on their team roster available to play.There was a lot of hype on Kai Sotto when he plays with the Magic on the Summer league, and I think the kid can still improved. And there was Jordan Clarkson as well who will be playing for the host Team Philippines if I'm not mistaken.But even if the US is going to send like not the best team, I think they can still win this tournament and I do agree that Canada will be the second favorite specially with the like of SGA and Jamal Murray.

comments.author: AHOYBRAUSE
comments.body: Quote from: Distinctin on August 03, 2023, 01:08:11 PMQuote from: Dave1 on August 03, 2023, 11:12:44 AMHowever, I think the Americans can and will win this tournament, it's not gonna be easy though.So for me, there could be some surprises on other brackets, specially if host country plays and they are the underdog.They are the best team in this tournament, but the USA did not send their best players, unlike before when they made sure they would win the competition. With the chemistry and experience of other national teams, they have a better advantage compared to the USA. The USA's advantage obviously lies in their talent, but you know, in crucial games, experience is more helpful than talent as it's about making the right decisions.I'm thinking maybe one of the 3 will win the FIBA world cup. 1-Australia2-France3-SpainI don't think any of those 3 can win to be honest. Australia is good but not great.The NBA players on the team are old or very young. Spain is solid in Europe but the golden generation is gone. About France, ok they have Gobert for defence and rebounds but who else? Batum is old, Fournier can shoot, but thats it's it, Ntilikina has no impact in the NBA yet. The rest are Euroleague players.I saw France yesterday against in their first test match against Montenegro and they didn't look impressive. Of course they just gathered and it's the first match but I am not impressed of what I saw.I would like to mention Slovenia, even though they lot their first test yesterday against a Giannis less Greece yesterday.Luka can make the difference against any team, so they can be a dark horse as well.

comments.author: danherbias07
comments.body: Quote from: rdbase on August 03, 2023, 01:10:11 PMMight be some players who want to keep in form playing in these brackets so would also be interesting to see a list of them on here and which teams they will be playing on.Could you make this happen @danherbias07 ?Such as Kai Sotto will be playing in this FIBA tournament for Team Philippines? Now that would be great for one of the host nations to have an actual NBA player on their team roster available to play.Sure. Will note that and will add it later on. Some countries are still unsure about their roster because players are not yet responding if they will play or not. Like Clarkson, there are rumors that he won't play last week I think, but it is not confirmed that he will play, it is Kai Sotto who is not yet confirmed. Quote from: Distinctin on August 03, 2023, 01:08:11 PMI'm thinking maybe one of the 3 will win the FIBA world cup. 1-Australia2-France3-SpainI like these picks. You didn't add the strongest team which is USA and Canada and I would like to see that too. Make the FIBA more competitive by having another champion. It will still depend on their Groups though, because there's a chance they will be eliminated there. Quote from: AHOYBRAUSE on August 03, 2023, 01:41:50 PMI would like to mention Slovenia, even though they lot their first test yesterday against a Giannis less Greece yesterday.Luka can make the difference against any team, so they can be a dark horse as well.That's true. Slovenia can be a wild card here. Although they were defeated by Greece yesterday, this is not yet the true game where Luka magic will be different. That guy's impact for the team is in a whole different level.

comments.author: owengtam09
comments.body: Look who's playing for Canada, it was Dillon "Dynasty" Brooks for sure Canada needs him to trash talk again for sure, but as a teammate Shai-Gilgeous Alexander, Kelly Olynyk, and Jamal Murray, this could become a power team, because the Scrubb siblings are not slack at all, And  surely the USA which consists only of NBA players is surely a power team in its own right sure they didn't put some veterans in there and consist only of 12 players while the other teams got almost consist of 20 to 22 teams if I am right, And for Iran, I will surely be surprised if I could see the Immortal Hamed Haddadi playing at FIBA that was insane as Lebron James same age, and if he could still bust a move back then I surely remember his insane height has become a problem for the Philippines back then, this will be insane, but surely if Kai Sotto and Jordan Clarkson is there playing there will  be a fighting chance, now that the NBA is making progress on October 2024 this will be a great alternative for us to make the topic and surely making bets, and support our favorite team,

comments.author: Natalim
comments.body: Quote from: owengtam09 on August 04, 2023, 01:00:36 AMLook who's playing for Canada, it was Dillon "Dynasty" Brooks for sure Canada needs him to trash talk again for sure, but as a teammate Shai-Gilgeous Alexander, Kelly Olynyk, and Jamal Murray, this could become a power team, because the Scrubb siblings are not slack at all, His trash talk would not work because this is an international competition, and teams are highly competitive. Players like Luka and the current number 1 pick, Victor Wembanyama, even said that the NBA is less physical compared to their leagues before. So, Brooks should not focus on his trash talk; instead, he should play hard and physical to live up to the expectations of the fans.The current lineup of Canada has some players who are superstars in the NBA. However, I'm looking at the team chemistry more than the individual players on the team. With that said, I stick with the more consistent teams, particularly Spain (despite less Gasol).

comments.author: Viscore
comments.body: Even the NBA knows that they are sending inexperience players in the FIBA world cup 2023. We can read this interesting article below from their website. https://www.nba.com/news/usa-basketball-roster-2023-fiba-world-cupQuoteThe 2019 team had Harrison Barnes (2016 Olympics) and Mason Plumlee (2014 World Cup). And every other U.S. team comprised of NBA players also had at least two guys with Senior-Team experience. Even the first team of NBA players (1992 Dream Team) had five – Patrick Ewing (1984 Olympics), Michael Jordan (’84), Christian Laettner (1990 World Championship), Chris Mullin (’84) and David Robinson (1986 World Championship and 1988 Olympics) – who had played on the Senior level previously.Every member of the 2023 team will be playing in his first Senior-level international tournament. It’s different than anything else they’ve ever experienced, especially when it comes to the single-elimination, knockout round.However, despite that, they are still the number 1 favorite to win. I'm thinking, aren't the bookies just making them overvalued as they know the bettors will bite on the odds? When we talk about "Team USA," it's a popular team and they have more gold compared to other teams. This popularity might influence the odds and make them seem more favorable than they actually are.
